Package org.framework.rodolfo.freire.git.vertlog.controller

Class BuyController

java.lang.Object
org.framework.rodolfo.freire.git.vertlog.controller.BuyController
@CrossOrigin(origins="*") @RestController @RequestMapping("/api") public class BuyController extends Object
This class represents a controller responsible for handling operations related to purchases. It receives HTTP requests, executes business operations through the BuyService service and returns appropriate responses to customers.

  • Method Details

    • getAllBuy

      @GetMapping("/buy") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllBuy()
      Retrieves all buy orders currently stored in the system.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of Buy objects or an appropriate error response. The list will be empty if no buy orders are found.
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - (optional) This exception might be thrown by the underlying service (buyService.findAll) if no buys are found. (Note: The specific exception thrown depends on your service implementation.)
      Exception - This generic exception catches any unexpected errors that occur during buy retrieval and logs the error for debugging purposes.

    • getBuyById

      @GetMapping("/buy/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getBuyById(@PathVariable int id)
      Retrieves a buy order by its identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the buy order to retrieve. (Path Variable)
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the requested buy order or an appropriate error response.
      Throws:
      BadRequestException - if the provided id is less than or equal to zero.

    • getBuyBetweenDates

      @GetMapping("/buy/date/{ini}/{end}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getBuyBetweenDates(@PathVariable String ini, @PathVariable String end)
      Retrieves buy orders within a specified date range. This method searches for buy orders whose dates fall between the provided ini and end dates (inclusive).
      Parameters:
      ini - (PathVariable) The start date of the search range in the expected format (defined by parseDate).
      end - (PathVariable) The end date of the search range in the expected format (defined by parseDate).
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of Buy objects found within the date range, or an appropriate error response. An empty Optional will be returned if no buys are found within the specified date range. A 400 (Bad Request) response will be returned if the provided dates are invalid.
      Throws:
      BuyParseException - This exception might be thrown by the parseDate method if the input date strings cannot be parsed successfully. (Note: The specific exceptions thrown depend on your implementation of parseDate.)

    • uploadDocument

      @PostMapping(consumes="multipart/form-data", value="/upload") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> uploadDocument(@RequestParam("file") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file)
